meanings.definition: Unable to be avoided or resisted.
meanings.sent1: The storm's arrival was ineluctable, and we had to prepare for it.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's ineluctable decision to assign homework disappointed the students.
meanings.sent3: It was ineluctable that the mischievous puppy would find its way into the mud puddle.
meanings.sent4: The ineluctable force of gravity pulled the object downward with great speed.
meanings.sent5: The ineluctable truth finally dawned on him, and he had to face the consequences.

meanings.sent1: The changing seasons bring the ineluctable shift from summer to autumn.
meanings.sent2: His ineluctable victory in the race was celebrated by his teammates.
meanings.sent3: The ineluctable meeting with his dentist made him nervous but also relieved.
meanings.sent4: The ineluctable march of time reminds us of our mortality.
meanings.sent5: The ineluctable outcome of the experiment proved the scientist's hypothesis correct.
